channel.title: Add On To Voting (Must Have Timers!) [PI]
channel.description:
Ok, soo if you have a voting timer system, this is a neat little addition that i added for my player, and just figured i would start my first ever rs-ps tutorial (Isnt my 1st tutorial done some vb.net & vb6 before). If this seems more like a snip. ill be happy to move. :) also im in a pretty good mood so no trolls...
Ok soo in client.java find: [code]public void clearQInterface() {[/code]
Under it should be some stuff such as: [code]getPA().sendFrame126("Oracle PvP: "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+" Online", 29155); //Tab Title[/code]
(Just mine, yours will most likely not look like that :P)
Add this:
[code]getPA().sendFrame126("Voting:", 29161); //1st section title if (voteClock == 0) { getPA().sendFrame126("Click Here To Vote!", 29162); //1rd section content } else if (voteClock >= 1) { getPA().sendFrame126("You Have Already Voted Today!", 29162); //1rd section content
}[/code] *You may have to change the ending number EX: [code]29162 to 29163 etc.[/code]
Also you will have to change the [code]voteClock[/code] To what ever you have that declared as.
If there are any bugs just post here, and if needed ill post a link for a nice vote timer. Also if requested ill add a code to send the player to the voting website upon clicking it.
Ok soo what this is doing is showing a caption in your quest interface, that will show if you have voted or not, and if you have will show a caption, and if you havent will show a caption.
Have a nice day guys.

item.title: Add On To Voting (Must Have Timers!) [PI]
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

[quote=“johnl17, post:11, topic:422840”][quote author=purestmage74 link=topic=525495.msg3826493#msg3826493 date=1322239571]
Lmfao, all you did was create a new int

public int voteClock = 0;

Than added that to the command. where’s the timer system?
Snippet, --shit
[/quote]
if your gonna release it add one…

Ok asshole, did i not already say you needed to have a timer system already?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Add On To Voting (Must Have Timers!) [PI]
item.dc:creator: @johnl17 johnl17
item.description:
@johnl17 wrote:

Ok, soo if you have a voting timer system, this is a neat little addition that i added for my player, and just figured i would start my first ever rs-ps tutorial (Isnt my 1st tutorial done some vb.net & vb6 before). If this seems more like a snip. ill be happy to move. also im in a pretty good mood so no trolls…

Ok soo in client.java find:

Under it should be some stuff such as:

(Just mine, yours will most likely not look like that :P)

Add this:

[code]getPA().sendFrame126(“Voting:”, 29161); //1st section title
if (voteClock == 0) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“Click Here To Vote!”, 29162); //1rd section content
} else if (voteClock >= 1) {
getPA().sendFrame126(“You Have Already Voted Today!”, 29162); //1rd section content

	}[/code]

*You may have to change the ending number EX: 29162 to 29163 etc.

Also you will have to change the voteClock To what ever you have that declared as.

If there are any bugs just post here, and if needed ill post a link for a nice vote timer. Also if requested ill add a code to send the player to the voting website upon clicking it.

Ok soo what this is doing is showing a caption in your quest interface, that will show if you have voted or not, and if you have will show a caption, and if you havent will show a caption.

Have a nice day guys.

Read full topic
